text: Busy days both on personal and professional levels! Thankfully, I'm busy in a good and productive way. Anyways, this is a series I'm a big fan of but somehow stopped playing after the 3rd game. I've been clearing a nice chunk of my huge backlog these past months and I eventually want to play MMBN4.
author: SupraDarky

text: 4 is probably the worst game, maybe discluding the 1st. 5 and 6 are much better than it though, so don't be discouraged by it!
author: MegaZeroX7

text: 4 is pretty good, its much better than 5 but don't expect it to be like 2,3, and 6.  It has a larger focus on game play and the new soul mechanics than the story.  One of the biggest problems people have with the game is the tournaments which make up a large portion of the game. Although before each match there is a story segment that is unique to every character in the tournament and in new game + you only fight against people you didn't in the first playthrough.  So each ng+ you do you get new scenes with the other tournament characters.  I do recommend skipping 5 if you need to save time because of the terrible board game mechanics.
author: Blaze2142

text: @Blaze2142 I actually think 5's mechanics are interesting. I mean, they can be gimmicky at times, but overall it was a breath of fresh air.
author: MegaZeroX7

text: Please Supra just skip MMBN4, it's like the Zelda CD-i of the BN Saga.
